articles.title: Satellite images reveal emptying famed sites, from Saudi to Iran
articles.description: Aerial photographs show normally bustling spots from Mecca to Beijing thinned of people as coronavirus spreads.
articles.content:
Empty public squares, a ghostly train station and deserted holy sites - a series of striking satellite images have revealed the impact of the coronavirus epidemic on some of the world's busiest spaces.

articles.title: EU holds emergency meeting over coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Coronavirus cases continue to rise sharply across Europe, with the Vatican, Serbia and Slovakia reporting their first infections on Friday.
articles.content:
Coronavirus cases continue to rise sharply across Europe.
The Vatican, Serbia and Slovakia reported their first infections on Friday.
Almost 1,000 new cases were confirmed in Italy in one day.

articles.title: Palestine declares state of emergency over coronavirus
articles.description: The move comes after seven people in the occupied West Bank test positive, prompting the Israeli army to seal off Bethlehem.
articles.content:
The Palestinian Authority has declared a state of emergency in the occupied West Bank over the coronavirus epidemic after seven people tested positive.

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Tensions escalate in Asia over coronavirus
articles.description: Japan's prime minister has imposed a mandatory quarantine on all visitors from South Korea and China, triggering warnings of countermeasures.
articles.content:
Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has imposed a mandatory quarantine on all visitors from South Korea and China.
South Korea, however, has called for it to be revoked, while also warning of countermeasures.
Al Jazeera's Rob McBride reports from Seoul.

articles.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Quarantine stories go viral online
articles.description: Many people are sharing their experience of dealing with being in lockdown.
articles.content:
The main way that governments are trying to contain coronavirus is quarantining people.
They hope that isolation can stop the spread.
But as quarantined people wait, much of the content they are sharing online has gone viral.
